thread.title: Marrying Physics, Fantasy and Fun with 'Strings of Time'
thread.title_full: Marrying Physics, Fantasy and Fun with 'Strings of Time' - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Marrying Physics, Fantasy and Fun with 'Strings of Time'
text:
Agni Entertainment
Agni Entertainment's Latest Production offers Time Travel through Dance
AUSTIN, Texas , Oct. 13, Agni Entertainment's newest production, " Strings of Time" is set at the dawn of our universe - 13.7 billion years ago and it marries together physics, fun and fantasy - exploring science, the cosmos and the mystifying philosophy of string theory. "Strings of Time " is an artistic portrayal about the story of our universe and how it came to be, and it features Aerialist, Flamenco, Contemporary, Tai Chi and three types of Indian dance styles (Kathak, Bharatanatyam and Kalari), backed by a soundtrack of stringed instruments, with the title track composed by Rohan Joseph .
Agni Entertainment's Founder and CEO - Prakash Mohandas - amazed Austin with his last production 'Om Shanti' - which was also held at the Long Center in August 2013 . His previous production boasted a grand set, 45 dancers, 20 actors, a 20 member orchestra and a large choir and crew - making it a 120 member performance that delighted the audience with an authentic Indian cultural experience, transporting them across the globe through live music, vibrant costumes, song, dance and imaginative sets.
In the latest production, various forms of dance and music merge to create the symphony of the universe featuring choreographers like Geeti Shirazi Mahajan–Ravaan Persian Dance Company; Divya Dinakar–Agni The Dance Company; Genevieve Guinn–Pink Flamenco; Preya Mangalat Patel–Devi School of Dance; Varsha Bankapure -Jawadekar and NrityaVarsha–NrityaVarsha Dance Academy; Annelize Machado–Maraa Dance Theater, and Tanya McCown–Four Elements Aerial & Creative Movement.
Strings of Time Director, Prakash Mohandas is very excited about this "beautiful, collaborative project. As a science geek and arts-lover, I saw an opportunity to bring the worlds of physics, fantasy and fun together through the creative art of dance," he adds. "But, don't expect answers to life, the universe and everything, or feel like you have to know about string theory to understand this collaboration. Come and get transported to a new land and have fun along the way."
For more information and to purchase tickets to Strings of Time, please visit http://thelongcenter.org/event/the-strings-of-time .
About Agni Entertainment
Agni Entertainment's prime focus is the production, promotion and distribution of independent film, theatre projects. Agni also aims to spread its wings into the arenas of media management and entertainment news. Its goal is to establish the missing links in the south Asian film industry outside of Asia and eventually create a thriving, stand-alone film industry in countries outside the Asian sub-continent.
About the Event
WHO : Agni Entertainment-who brought Austin the "Om Shanti" musical and Bollywood Day
WHAT : "Strings of Time"-a dance-focused journey 13 billion years through space and time
WHEN : Oct. 22 , 7:00 pm ; Oct. 23 , 7:00 pm ; Oct. 24 , 3pm and 7pm ; Oct. 25 , 3pm
WHERE : The Long Center for the Performing Arts Rollins Studio, 701 Riverside Dr., Austin, TX 78704
TICKETS : www.thelongcenter.org/event/the-strings-of-time/ | student discounts available
WEB : agnientertainment.com | www.facebook.com/events/1468899536755186/
MEDIA : For information, interviews, or photos, contact jenni@wyattbrand.com or 512.904.9928
About Prakash Mohandas , Director and Producer
Prakash Mohandas is the founder and CEO of Agni Entertainment. He is a filmmaker, entrepreneur, actor, dancer, and musician and is also the founder of Agni Dance Company and Agni Performing Arts based in Austin, TX. His most recent work Om Shanti, was a stage production of the famous Bollywood musical and is the founder of Austin Bollywood Day.
